result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Werchowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit 14 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-Working Hours with Standard Release Conditions-All 30 days STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Clerk's letter to defendant advising his request for early release is denied
WC inmate communication form received 05/21/15, from the Defendant to Judge Foster, requesting amendment to JOC.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 04/03/15
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew J Werchowski in court, in custody, with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 90 days Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED.  Credit for 14 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. 
CONDITION TIME: 30 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - All 30 days STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 60 days.

Defendant Andrew J Werchowski in court, in custody, with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant moves to modify bail.  State objects to any modification.  Court deferrs the bail request to the Judge at the next hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
